metadata.title: CVE-2014-4607 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Integer overflow in the LZO algorithm variant in Oberhumer liblzo2 andlzo-2 before 2.07 on 32-bit platforms might allow remote attackers toexecute arbitrary code via a crafted Literal Run.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-4607` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

liblzo2-2 - 2.06-1.2ubuntu2
No subscription required

krfb - 4:4.13.97-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

grub-common - 2.04-1ubuntu26.8
grub-coreboot - 2.04-1ubuntu26.8
grub-coreboot-bin - 2.04-1ubuntu26.8
grub-efi - 2.04-1ubuntu26.8
grub-efi-amd64 - 2.04-1ubuntu26.8

grub2 - 2.04-1ubuntu26.8

No subscription required

grub-efi-amd64-signed - 1.142.10+2.04-1ubuntu26.8
grub-efi-arm64-signed - 1.142.10+2.04-1ubuntu26.8
No subscription required

grub-efi-amd64 - 2.04-1ubuntu47.4

criterions.comment: lzo2 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.06-1.2ubuntu2').
krfb package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4:4.13.97-0ubuntu2').
grub2 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.04-1ubuntu26.8').
grub2-signed package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.142.10').
grub2-unsigned package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.04-1ubuntu47.4').
